connector.description: Send and receive messages from NATS messaging system.

camel.source.path.topic.name: camel.source.path.topic
camel.source.path.topic.description: The name of topic we want to use

camel.source.endpoint.flushConnection.name: camel.source.endpoint.flushConnection
camel.source.endpoint.flushConnection.description: Define if we want to flush connection when stopping or not

camel.source.endpoint.maxPingsOut.name: camel.source.endpoint.maxPingsOut
camel.source.endpoint.maxPingsOut.description: maximum number of pings have not received a response allowed by the client

camel.source.endpoint.noEcho.name: camel.source.endpoint.noEcho
camel.source.endpoint.noEcho.description: Turn off echo. If supported by the gnatsd version you are connecting to this flag will prevent the server from echoing messages back to the connection if it has subscriptions on the subject being published to.

camel.source.endpoint.noRandomizeServers.name: camel.source.endpoint.noRandomizeServers
camel.source.endpoint.noRandomizeServers.description: Whether or not randomizing the order of servers for the connection attempts

camel.source.endpoint.pedantic.name: camel.source.endpoint.pedantic
camel.source.endpoint.pedantic.description: Whether or not running in pedantic mode (this affects performance)

camel.source.endpoint.pingInterval.name: camel.source.endpoint.pingInterval
camel.source.endpoint.pingInterval.description: Ping interval to be aware if connection is still alive (in milliseconds)

camel.source.endpoint.reconnect.name: camel.source.endpoint.reconnect
camel.source.endpoint.reconnect.description: Whether or not using reconnection feature

camel.source.endpoint.reconnectTimeWait.name: camel.source.endpoint.reconnectTimeWait
camel.source.endpoint.reconnectTimeWait.description: Waiting time before attempts reconnection (in milliseconds)

camel.source.endpoint.requestCleanupInte.name: camel.source.endpoint.requestCleanupInterval
camel.source.endpoint.requestCleanupInte.description: Interval to clean up cancelled/timed out requests.

camel.source.endpoint.servers.name: camel.source.endpoint.servers
camel.source.endpoint.servers.description: URLs to one or more NAT servers. Use comma to separate URLs when specifying multiple servers.

camel.source.endpoint.verbose.name: camel.source.endpoint.verbose
camel.source.endpoint.verbose.description: Whether or not running in verbose mode

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.maxMessages.name: camel.source.endpoint.maxMessages
camel.source.endpoint.maxMessages.description: Stop receiving messages from a topic we are subscribing to after maxMessages

camel.source.endpoint.queueName.name: camel.source.endpoint.queueName
camel.source.endpoint.queueName.description: The Queue name if we are using nats for a queue configuration

camel.source.endpoint.replyToDisabled.name: camel.source.endpoint.replyToDisabled
camel.source.endpoint.replyToDisabled.description: Can be used to turn off sending back reply message in the consumer.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.connection.name: camel.source.endpoint.connection
camel.source.endpoint.connection.description: Reference an already instantiated connection to Nats server

camel.source.endpoint.traceConnection.name: camel.source.endpoint.traceConnection
camel.source.endpoint.traceConnection.description: Whether or not connection trace messages should be printed to standard out for fine grained debugging of connection issues.

camel.source.endpoint.secure.name: camel.source.endpoint.secure
camel.source.endpoint.secure.description: Set secure option indicating TLS is required

camel.component.nats.servers.name: camel.component.nats.servers
camel.component.nats.servers.description: URLs to one or more NAT servers. Use comma to separate URLs when specifying multiple servers.

camel.component.nats.verbose.name: camel.component.nats.verbose
camel.component.nats.verbose.description: Whether or not running in verbose mode

camel.component.nats.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.component.nats.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.nats.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.nats.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.nats.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.nats.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.nats.useGlobalSslContext.name: camel.component.nats.useGlobalSslContextParameters
camel.component.nats.useGlobalSslContext.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.
